title: India at a Glance - Essential Facts
content:
# India at a Glance - Essential Facts

## Basic Information
- **Official Name**: Republic of India (Bharat Ganrajya)
- **Capital**: New Delhi
- **Largest City**: Mumbai
- **Area**: 3,287,263 sq km (7th largest in world)
- **Population**: 1.4+ billion (2nd most populous)

## National Symbols
| Symbol | Name |
|--------|------|
| National Flag | Tiranga (Tricolor) |
| National Emblem | Lion Capital of Ashoka |
| National Anthem | Jana Gana Mana |
| National Song | Vande Mataram |
| National Animal | Bengal Tiger |
| National Bird | Indian Peacock |
| National Flower | Lotus |
| National Tree | Banyan |
| National Fruit | Mango |
| National River | Ganga |
| National Aquatic Animal | Ganges River Dolphin |
| National Heritage Animal | Elephant |

## Geographic Extremes
- **Northernmost Point**: Indira Col, Siachen Glacier
- **Southernmost Point**: Indira Point, Great Nicobar
- **Easternmost Point**: Kibithu, Arunachal Pradesh
- **Westernmost Point**: Guhar Moti, Gujarat

## State Facts
- **Largest State (Area)**: Rajasthan (342,239 sq km)
- **Smallest State (Area)**: Goa (3,702 sq km)
- **Most Populous State**: Uttar Pradesh
- **Least Populous State**: Sikkim
- **Most Literate State**: Kerala (96.2%)
- **Highest Density**: Bihar

## Important Numbers
- **Total States**: 28
- **Union Territories**: 8
- **Total Districts**: 773
- **Official Languages**: 22 (Scheduled)
- **National Language**: Hindi (Official), English (Associate Official)

## Neighboring Countries
1. Pakistan (West)
2. China (North)
3. Nepal (North)
4. Bhutan (Northeast)
5. Bangladesh (East)
6. Myanmar (East)
7. Sri Lanka (South - Maritime)
8. Maldives (Southwest - Maritime)

title: World Geography - Countries & Capitals
content:
# World Geography - Countries & Capitals

## Continents
| Continent | Largest Country | Smallest Country |
|-----------|-----------------|------------------|
| Asia | Russia/China | Maldives |
| Africa | Algeria | Seychelles |
| North America | Canada | St. Kitts & Nevis |
| South America | Brazil | Suriname |
| Europe | Russia | Vatican City |
| Australia/Oceania | Australia | Nauru |
| Antarctica | - | - |

## Important Countries & Capitals

### Asia
| Country | Capital | Currency |
|---------|---------|----------|
| India | New Delhi | Rupee (INR) |
| China | Beijing | Yuan (CNY) |
| Japan | Tokyo | Yen (JPY) |
| South Korea | Seoul | Won (KRW) |
| Saudi Arabia | Riyadh | Riyal (SAR) |
| UAE | Abu Dhabi | Dirham (AED) |
| Singapore | Singapore | Dollar (SGD) |
| Thailand | Bangkok | Baht (THB) |

### Europe
| Country | Capital | Currency |
|---------|---------|----------|
| UK | London | Pound (GBP) |
| France | Paris | Euro (EUR) |
| Germany | Berlin | Euro (EUR) |
| Italy | Rome | Euro (EUR) |
| Spain | Madrid | Euro (EUR) |
| Russia | Moscow | Ruble (RUB) |
| Switzerland | Bern | Franc (CHF) |

### Americas
| Country | Capital | Currency |
|---------|---------|----------|
| USA | Washington D.C. | Dollar (USD) |
| Canada | Ottawa | Dollar (CAD) |
| Brazil | Brasilia | Real (BRL) |
| Argentina | Buenos Aires | Peso (ARS) |
| Mexico | Mexico City | Peso (MXN) |

## World Records
- **Largest Country**: Russia (17.1 million sq km)
- **Smallest Country**: Vatican City (0.44 sq km)
- **Most Populous**: China/India
- **Longest River**: Nile (6,650 km)
- **Largest Ocean**: Pacific Ocean
- **Highest Mountain**: Mt. Everest (8,849 m)
- **Largest Desert**: Sahara (Hot), Antarctic (Cold)
- **Deepest Ocean Point**: Mariana Trench (11,034 m)

title: Important National & International Days
content:
# Important National & International Days

## National Days of India

### January
- **January 12**: National Youth Day (Swami Vivekananda Birthday)
- **January 15**: Army Day
- **January 23**: Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose Jayanti
- **January 25**: National Voters Day, National Tourism Day
- **January 26**: Republic Day
- **January 30**: Martyrs' Day (Mahatma Gandhi Death Anniversary)

### February - March
- **February 28**: National Science Day
- **March 8**: International Women's Day

### April - May
- **April 5**: National Maritime Day
- **April 14**: Dr. B.R. Ambedkar Jayanti
- **May 1**: Labour Day, Maharashtra Day, Gujarat Day
- **May 11**: National Technology Day
- **May 21**: Anti-Terrorism Day

### June - August
- **June 5**: World Environment Day
- **June 21**: International Yoga Day
- **July 1**: National Doctor's Day
- **July 26**: Kargil Vijay Diwas
- **August 15**: Independence Day
- **August 29**: National Sports Day (Dhyan Chand Birthday)

### September - October
- **September 5**: Teachers' Day (Radhakrishnan Birthday)
- **September 14**: Hindi Diwas
- **October 2**: Gandhi Jayanti
- **October 8**: Indian Air Force Day
- **October 31**: National Unity Day (Sardar Patel Birthday)

### November - December
- **November 14**: Children's Day (Nehru Birthday)
- **November 19**: National Integration Day
- **November 26**: Constitution Day
- **December 1**: World AIDS Day
- **December 4**: Indian Navy Day
- **December 10**: Human Rights Day
- **December 22**: National Mathematics Day (Ramanujan Birthday)

## International Days
- **March 22**: World Water Day
- **April 7**: World Health Day
- **April 22**: Earth Day
- **May 31**: World No Tobacco Day
- **June 5**: World Environment Day
- **October 24**: United Nations Day
- **November 14**: World Diabetes Day
- **December 1**: World AIDS Day

title: Important Awards and Honours
content:
# Important Awards and Honours

## Indian Civilian Awards (Padma Awards)

| Award | Rank | Criteria |
|-------|------|----------|
| Bharat Ratna | Highest | Exceptional service to nation |
| Padma Vibhushan | 2nd | Distinguished service |
| Padma Bhushan | 3rd | Distinguished service of high order |
| Padma Shri | 4th | Distinguished service |

### Notable Bharat Ratna Recipients
- **First Recipients (1954)**: C. Rajagopalachari, S. Radhakrishnan, C.V. Raman
- **Sachin Tendulkar**: Youngest recipient (40 years, 2014)
- **Lata Mangeshkar**: 2001
- **A.P.J. Abdul Kalam**: 1997
- **Mother Teresa**: 1980

## Military Awards (Gallantry)

| Award | Rank | For |
|-------|------|-----|
| Param Vir Chakra | Highest | Wartime Bravery |
| Ashoka Chakra | Highest | Peacetime Bravery |
| Mahavir Chakra | 2nd | Wartime |
| Kirti Chakra | 2nd | Peacetime |
| Vir Chakra | 3rd | Wartime |
| Shaurya Chakra | 3rd | Peacetime |

## Nobel Prize (International)

### Indian Nobel Laureates
| Name | Year | Field |
|------|------|-------|
| Rabindranath Tagore | 1913 | Literature |
| C.V. Raman | 1930 | Physics |
| Har Gobind Khorana | 1968 | Medicine |
| Mother Teresa | 1979 | Peace |
| Amartya Sen | 1998 | Economics |
| Kailash Satyarthi | 2014 | Peace |
| Abhijit Banerjee | 2019 | Economics |

## Sports Awards (India)
- **Rajiv Gandhi Khel Ratna**: Highest Sports Award
- **Arjuna Award**: Outstanding Sports Performance
- **Dronacharya Award**: Excellence in Coaching
- **Dhyan Chand Award**: Lifetime Achievement in Sports

title: Important Firsts in India
content:
# Important Firsts in India

## Political Firsts
| Position | Name | Year |
|----------|------|------|
| First President | Dr. Rajendra Prasad | 1950 |
| First Prime Minister | Jawaharlal Nehru | 1947 |
| First Woman President | Pratibha Patil | 2007 |
| First Woman Prime Minister | Indira Gandhi | 1966 |
| First Vice President | Dr. S. Radhakrishnan | 1952 |
| First Chief Justice | H.J. Kania | 1950 |
| First Woman Chief Justice | No woman CJI yet | - |
| First Woman Governor | Sarojini Naidu | 1947 |
| First Woman Chief Minister | Sucheta Kriplani (UP) | 1963 |
| First Chief Election Commissioner | Sukumar Sen | 1950 |

## Scientific & Space Firsts
| Achievement | Name/Details | Year |
|-------------|--------------|------|
| First Indian in Space | Rakesh Sharma | 1984 |
| First Woman in Space (Indian-American) | Kalpana Chawla | 1997 |
| First Indian Satellite | Aryabhata | 1975 |
| First Nuclear Test | Pokhran-I (Smiling Buddha) | 1974 |
| First Moon Mission | Chandrayaan-1 | 2008 |
| First Mars Mission | Mangalyaan | 2014 |

## Military Firsts
| Achievement | Name | Year |
|-------------|------|------|
| First Field Marshal | Sam Manekshaw | 1973 |
| First Woman IPS Officer | Kiran Bedi | 1972 |
| First Woman IAF Pilot | Harita Kaur Deol | 1994 |
| First Woman Fighter Pilot | Avani Chaturvedi | 2016 |
| First Woman Army General | Punita Arora | 2004 |

## Sports Firsts
| Achievement | Name | Year |
|-------------|------|------|
| First Olympic Medal | Norman Pritchard (Silver) | 1900 |
| First Olympic Gold | Hockey Team | 1928 |
| First Individual Olympic Gold | Abhinav Bindra | 2008 |
| First World Cup Cricket Win | 1983 Team | 1983 |
| First Woman Olympic Medalist | Karnam Malleswari | 2000 |

## Other Firsts
- **First Railway**: Mumbai to Thane (1853)
- **First University**: Calcutta University (1857)
- **First Bank**: Bank of Hindustan (1770)
- **First Newspaper**: Bengal Gazette (1780)
- **First Film**: Raja Harishchandra (1913)
- **First Talkie Film**: Alam Ara (1931)

title: International Organizations & Headquarters
content:
# International Organizations & Headquarters

## United Nations System

| Organization | Full Form | Headquarters | Founded |
|--------------|-----------|--------------|----------|
| UN | United Nations | New York | 1945 |
| UNESCO | UN Educational, Scientific & Cultural Org. | Paris | 1945 |
| UNICEF | UN Children's Fund | New York | 1946 |
| WHO | World Health Organization | Geneva | 1948 |
| ILO | International Labour Organization | Geneva | 1919 |
| FAO | Food and Agriculture Organization | Rome | 1945 |
| IMF | International Monetary Fund | Washington D.C. | 1944 |
| World Bank | World Bank Group | Washington D.C. | 1944 |
| WTO | World Trade Organization | Geneva | 1995 |
| IAEA | International Atomic Energy Agency | Vienna | 1957 |

## UN Security Council
- **Permanent Members (P5)**: USA, UK, France, Russia, China
- **Veto Power**: Only P5 members
- **Total Members**: 15 (5 Permanent + 10 Non-permanent)

## Regional Organizations

| Organization | Headquarters | Members |
|--------------|--------------|----------|
| SAARC | Kathmandu | 8 South Asian |
| ASEAN | Jakarta | 10 Southeast Asian |
| EU | Brussels | 27 European |
| African Union | Addis Ababa | 55 African |
| NATO | Brussels | 31 members |
| OPEC | Vienna | 13 oil exporters |
| G7 | Rotating | USA, UK, France, Germany, Italy, Canada, Japan |
| G20 | Rotating | 19 countries + EU |
| BRICS | Rotating | Brazil, Russia, India, China, South Africa |

## Economic Organizations
| Organization | Purpose |
|--------------|----------|
| IMF | Global monetary cooperation |
| World Bank | Development financing |
| WTO | Trade regulation |
| ADB | Asian development bank |
| AIIB | Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank |

## India's Membership
- UN Member: 1945 (Founding member)
- NAM Member: 1961 (Founding member)
- G20 Member: 1999
- BRICS Member: 2009
- SCO Member: 2017
